H0.text: Since 1951, what is the maximum number of full consecutive terms to be filled by one US president. 1

H1.text: Since 1951, what is the maximum number of full consecutive terms to be filled by one US president. 3

H2.text: Since 1951, what is the maximum number of full consecutive terms to be filled by one US president. 4

H3.text: Since 1951, what is the maximum number of full consecutive terms to be filled by one US president. 2

A4.text: Section 1. No person shall be elected to the office of the President more than twice, and no person who has held the office of President, or acted as President, for more than two years of a term to which some other person was elected President shall be elected to the office of the President more than once.

A5.text: the process was completed on February 27, 1951, when the requisite 36 of the 48 states had ratified the amendment (neither Alaska nor Hawaii had yet been admitted as a state), and its provisions came into force on that date.
